text: John Cunningham Whitehead (April 2, 1922 - February 7, 2015) was an American banker and civil servant. He was a board member of the World Trade Center Memorial Foundation (WTC Memorial Foundation). He was chairman of the Lower Manhattan Development Corporation."Whitehead Resigns as LMDC Chairman" @ LMDC - Lower Manhattan.info - May 11, 2006 Whitehead served as United States Deputy Secretary of State under the Ronald Reagan administration from 1985 through 1989. ==References== Category:1922 births Category:2015 deaths Category:Businesspeople from Evanston, Illinois Category:Businesspeople from New York City Category:Cancer deaths in New York City Category:Harvard University alumni Category:Politicians from Evanston, Illinois Category:Politicians from New York City Category:United States Deputy Secretaries of State Category:Republican Party (United States) politicians
